required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Acute Labetalol Use in Preeclampsia Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to understand if administration of a personalized dose of the anti-hypertensive medication, labetalol, based on patient's body-mass index, will be more effective at controlling severe hypertension during pregnancy, compared to the current standard dosing.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators seek to asses the effect of obesity (BMI>30) on severe hypertension control in patients with preeclampsia with severe features. The investigators hypothesize that successive administration of 40-60-80 mg of labetolol will reduce time to blood pressure control versus the standard dosing, 20-40-80 mg labetolol, recommended by the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists in 2015.

study_design_info.masking_description: The principle investigator and outcomes assessor are masked to group assignment.

primary_outcome.description: The length of time the subject continued to have non-severe range blood pressure following administration of labetolol.

secondary_outcome.description: The difference in time for blood pressure control amongst racial groups
Anticipated and unanticipated maternal events including Symptomatic hypotension, bradsycardia, bronchospam, seizure, stroke, death
complications experienced by the neonate including PGAR score < 5, need for respiratory support, blood glucose, death

arm_group.description: Subjects receive 40mg, 60mg 80mg in succession after each severe BP
Subjects receive 20mg, 40mg 80mg in succession after each severe BP

intervention.description: Subjects who have sustained severe hypertension (SBP≥160 mmHg and/or DBP≥110 mmHg), 15 min apart receive the experimental dosing of labetolol. Subjects in both groups are managed following the standard guidelines established by ACOG (Committee Opinion #623). For each successive episode of hypertension treatment, patients are asked a set of questions to monitor for adverse medication side-effects. The fetus is electronically monitored for four hours after the last IV dose.

Subjects who have sustained severe hypertension (SBP≥160 mmHg and/or DBP≥110 mmHg), 15 min apart receive the standard dosing of labetolol. Subjects in both groups are managed following the standard guidelines established by ACOG (Committee Opinion #623). For each successive episode of hypertension treatment, patients are asked a set of questions to monitor for adverse medication side-effects. The fetus is electronically monitored for four hours after the last IV dose.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI ≥ 30
- Age ≥ 18 years
- Gestational age ≥ 24 weeks
- Singleton gestation
- One sustained severe range blood pressure at Albany Medical Center
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known allergic reaction to labetlol
- Persistent mild-moderate asthma (≥ 2 rescue inhaler uses per week in the previous month)
- Obstructive airway disease
- Bradycardia < 70 beats/min
- Heart block > 1st degree or history of heart failure

facility.name: Albany Medical Center Obstetrics and Gynecology

results_reference.citation: Committee on Obstetric Practice. Committee Opinion No. 623: Emergent therapy for acute-onset, severe hypertension during pregnancy and the postpartum period. Obstet Gynecol. 2015 Feb;125(2):521-5. doi: 10.1097/01.AOG.0000460762.59152.d7.
